text.p: Lithuanian newspapers carried the following reports in their Tuesday editions. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- A parliamentary commission decided on Monday to ask parliament to revoke the immunity of MP Audrius Butkevichius, who is alleged to have taken a $15,000 bribe.
Parliament is expected to vote in its session this morning.

- Two Newsweek photographers, Andres Hernandez and his wife Monika Abraityte, were beaten by four skinheads in Vilnius on Sunday while trying to defend a victim who was being attacked by the hooligans. Police arrested the four skinheads.

- The chairman of parliament Vytautas Landabergis said that Lithuanian President Algirdas Brazauskas and former prosecutor general Arturas Paulauskas met on Friday to discuss the tactics for the December presidential election. All three are considered serious candidates.
- Blue chip Rokishkis Cheese jumped to 55 litas from 50.22 litas on Monday.
- A soldier armed with a machine gun and 60 bullets escaped from his post in the Radvilishkis district on Monday.
- Experts say that good banking and corporate results in the first half of 1997 prompted the recent gains on the Vilnius bourse.
- Fridge producer Snaige posted a 2.5 million litas net profit in July.
- Lithuanian President Algirdas Brazauskas noted the economic progress achieved by the country this year and praised the work of the government in his televised speech on Monday.
Brazauskas said he wanted better relations with parliament and expressed concern about the growing crime rate.
- Around two hundred of the 900 illegal immigrants in Lithuania have asked for refugee status.
